definition: healthy/to invigorate/to strengthen/to be good at/to be strong in
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: Here are five steps you can take to help your machines run much faster.
sentences.chinese: 以下是能讓你的機器健步如飛起來的五個步驟。

sentences.english: Target moved Jianbu thoughts in my mind swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 瞄準感動，思緒在我腦中健步如飛。

sentences.english: Tom was a quick walker and soon got ahead of the others.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆是個健步如飛者，很快就走到其他人前面去了。

definition: sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to form a picture/to develop a photo/to visualize
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
